info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 12:54AM CDT until August 17 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas, including flooded underpasses, roads, and streets.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen according to radar estimates and gauge measurements. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over portions of the advisory area. Runoff from the rain that has already fallen and additional rainfall will result in flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, South Lawndale, Midway Airport, Chicago Lawn, Austin, Bridgeport, Englewood, West Town, Chicago Loop, Lincoln Park, Roseland, South Shore, Burbank, Melrose Park, Maywood and Brookfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
